channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: We Hunted Hidden Police Signals at the DNC
item.description: Using special software, WIRED investigated police surveillance at the DNC. We collected signals from nearly 300,000 devices, revealing vulnerabilities...

item.title: Kinsome aims to bridge the generation gap with its new app for kids and grandparents
item.description: Over a year ago, former Session M exec Eben Pingree received the news that his mother was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s. Two days later, his father-in-la...

item.title: The US Needs Deepfake Porn Laws. These States Are Leading the Way
item.description: Legislation addressing the crisis of deepfake porn is being proposed, passing, and failing at the state level all over the US. WIRED is keeping track ...

item.title: Reonic raises €13 million to help small installers of green tech like heat pumps and solar panels
item.description: European regulators are pushing hard for greener energy. The REPowerEU plan calls for 10 million additional heat pumps to be added by 2027, and solar ...

item.title: Right-Wing Influencer Network Tenet Media Allegedly Spread Russian Disinformation
item.description: In an unsealed indictment, the DOJ alleges that employees of state-owned RT contracted for and oversaw the dissemination of Kremlin talking points by ...

item.title: Boom’s macOS camera app lets you customize your video call appearance
item.description: As someone who talks to many people outside my time zone, I often spend at least a few minutes on a video call explaining my location, time, and weath...

item.title: The Internet Archive Loses Its Appeal of a Major Copyright Case
item.description: Hachette v. Internet Archive was brought by book publishers objecting to the archive’s digital lending library.

item.title: Those ‘Founder mode’ memes keep coming

item.title: This Could Be the Start of Amazon’s Next Robot Revolution
item.description: The ecommerce giant has acquired a team to give robots greater intelligence and dexterity—potentially automating much more of its warehouse operations...

item.title: Andreessen Horowitz shutters its Miami office after two years
item.description: Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) has closed a satellite office in Miami Beach just two years into a five-year lease it signed for an 8,300-square-foot space...
